title: EXECUTIVE PRODUCER, ANIMATION, GAMES & INNOVATION
description:
We are seeking a dynamic **Executive Producer** to lead the production of high-quality animated content for games and interactive experiences. This role requires a strategic thinker with deep industry knowledge, strong leadership skills, and a passion for pioneering new storytelling techniques. Our ideal candidate is someone with a love for games and a deep understanding of the games industry, including familiarity with game publishers, developers, and fan communities.

The right person for this role is excited by innovation challenges, not intimidated by them – working with the team to come up with new solutions and pushing the boundaries of our creative and technical offerings to our clients with a strong knowledge of the latest in emerging tech and AI capabilities. Whether working in a traditional pipeline, a game engine, or the latest in AI tools, the EP in this role will be able to comfortably navigate a wide range of creative and technical challenges in collaboration with our team.

The Executive Producer will oversee multiple projects, manage budgets and schedules, and work closely with creative and technical teams to deliver engaging and visually stunning content. Part of what makes EP-ing at Psyop exciting is that no two projects are the same, and there is endless opportunity to explore new creative and technical approaches.

The ideal candidate will be located within the Los Angeles or New York area but candidates located remotely throughout the United States with the desired experience will be considered as well.

#### **POSITION OVERVIEW**

* This role is open to both Freelance and Full-Time candidates.
* This role will lead and oversee the development and production of animation projects for games and interactive media, ensuring alignment with the company’s vision and goals.
* This role will be a creative partner for our directors, always able and ready to offer up suggestions and resources to support their vision.
* Role will require a combination of qualities; encompassing those of a Creative Strategist, Producer, Talent Manager and Sales Professional.
* This role will uphold a positive force within the studio, keeping spirits up and morale high while being a supporting and grounding presence with producers, crew and other team members.
* This role will be a trusted partner for clients, always ready to help figure out a project while being a strategic and entrepreneurial thinker, identifying and going after promising opportunities, while building and maintaining long term relationships.
* This role will drive the exploration and development of Emerging Technologies for use in Psyop projects.
* Using their contacts within the Games/Interactive/Immersive industry, this EP will develop an innovation strategy to identify opportunities in the emerging technology landscape.
* Ideal candidates will have an excellent understanding of Psyop’s strategic vision and how to achieve that vision while at the same time finding opportunities to increase sales.

#### **RESPONSIBILITES**

*Will include but are not limited to;*

* Lead and oversee the development and production of animation projects for games and interactive media, ensuring alignment with the company’s vision and goals.
* Develop, cultivate and maintain relationships with current and new clients and external partners.
* Identify and secure new business opportunities, helping to expand the company’s reach in the gaming and interactive entertainment sectors. Key decision maker in project selection.
* Establish pitch strategy and manage pitches by clearly defining what needs to be done to succeed creatively and financially, making sure to collaborate effectively with directors.
* Collaborate with creative directors, game designers, animators, writers, and technical teams to shape compelling narratives and innovative experiences.
* Oversee bidding and the development of a potential production plan. Work with HoPs to determine resource allocation strategies.
* Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources, ensuring on-time and on-budget delivery of high-quality content from beginning to end.
* Mentor producers throughout the course of production, helping to guide margins, creative trouble shooting and client communications.
* Drive innovation in animation pipelines, production workflows, and emerging technologies to enhance production efficiency and creativity.
* Foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the production team.
* Be a thought leader on creative production internally and externally, advocating for our craft.
* Must exhibit hands-on technology leadership in development of projects, including but not limited to ideation and selection of which technologies are appropriate for each opportunity.

#### **EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS**

* 5+ years of experience as a Senior Producer and/or 3+ years as an Executive Producer (or an equivalent leadership role) in the animation and/or games industry.
* Passion for storytelling, innovation, and pushing the boundaries of what animation can achieve in gaming and interactive experiences.
* Must have a good range of production experience dealing with various creative approaches at varying budget levels.
* Must have a strong understanding of the 2D & 3D pipeline and process. As well as knowledge and passion for emerging technologies such as AI, gaming engines, and procedural content generation.
* Excellent communication and project management skills.
* Able to anticipate production challenges and problem solve.
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Must be able to present creative opinions in a clear and concise manner.
* Must be able to juggle multiple projects and tasks at one time while staying organized.
* Must be able to work well within a team environment and have strong interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of CETA iCFM software is a plus.

*Psyop is committed to building and maintaining an inclusive workplace. We offer flexible working practices and welcome and encourage applications from candidates who are under-represented in the creative industries.*

*Psyop provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

*In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.*

*The approximate salary range for this role will be between $150k – $180k annually depending on experience.*

title: Freelance Photo Retoucher - Remote
description:
Lensa is the leading career site for job seekers at every stage of their career. Our client, BaubleBar, is seeking professionals. Apply via Lensa today!
  
  
**Who We Are**
BaubleBar designs accessories that make life more fun. Founded in 2010, the Company is known for its statement-making styles that create joy and bring people together. Today, BaubleBar’s unabashedly optimistic perspective can be found across multiple accessory categories that are sold direct to consumer and at 8,500+ retail stores globally.
  
  
**What We’re Looking For**
We're seeking a skilled and experienced eCommerce photo Retoucher who is passionate about delivering high-quality, visually appealing images. Our ideal candidate is detail-oriented, efficient, and has a keen eye for enhancing product photos to meet our brand standards. Working closely with our Senior Retoucher and our Creative team, we are seeking someone who will thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, and collaborative environment.

* Collaborate with our creative team and photographers to retouch product still life and on figure images for our eCommerce platform and wholesale partners
* Ensure consistency in image quality, color accuracy, and style across all product categories
* Retouch and enhance images to meet the brand's visual standards while maintaining a natural and authentic look
* Rename photos and products according to provided brand guidelines
* Accurately identify files on the internal network and follow a detailed workflow
* Work efficiently under tight deadlines, managing and prioritizing multiple projects simultaneously
* Exchange feedback and communicate effectively with the creative team to achieve the desired outcome
* Stay updated on industry trends and retouching techniques to enhance the overall quality of our product images

* Proven experience as a freelance eCommerce photo Retoucher for at least one year with a strong portfolio showcasing before-and-after samples
* Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop and a solid understanding of color correction, image enhancement, and masking techniques
* Attention to detail and a strong sense of aesthetics to maintain the brand's visual identity
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a remote and fast-paced environment without sacrificing overall image quality
* Strong communication skills and responsiveness to feedback
* Familiarity with Capture One is a huge plus
* Understanding of eCommerce photo standards and requirements
* Demonstrated adaptability to new tools and processes in a dynamic work environment
* Strong organizational skills are a must to manage and prioritize photo retouching tasks effectively
* Familiarity with various product categories, including jewelry, fashion and accessories is a plus
* Position will be remote (residing in the United States and authorized to work in the U.S.)

**What We Offer**

* Starting Freelance range for this role is $20-25.00 per hour

description:

Analyzes and determines training needs and problems. Develops, administers, and implements all training programs per the Business’ initiatives and strategies. Conducts special courses designed for training selected groups of employees.

* Conducts job-task analysis and/or needs assessment to identify learning objectives and to determine training solutions and other performance enhancement solutions (e.g., management reinforcement, rewards, role clarity, job aids, etc.)

Bachelor’s degree and/or relevant certification and job related experience

* 5 years in training, education, development, design, training technology or related field.
* Solid knowledge of course development software and authoring tools to develop more sophisticated instructor led and online learning materials that includes multi-media and interactive learning.
* Proven work experience preparing courses for e-Learning in a Learning Management System. Ability to write effective training notes, instructional text, audio scripts, video scripts.

Master’s Degree

* 5+ years experience with course development software and authoring tools, such as: Articulate Storyline, Captivate, Camtasia, DominKnow, etc.

title: Creative Director (Art Direction)
description:
**Overview**
**Working at Atlassian**
Atlassians can choose where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.
  
  
Atlassian is used by teams around the world for everything from pizza deliveries to space travel. To help us achieve our mission of unleashing the potential of every team, the Atlassian Creative Studio is looking for a
**Creative Director**
to extend our storytelling and reach our ever growing audience. You'll be fully remote and report to a Group Creative Director while working with a vibrant, and globally distributed creative team to create impact and delight while pushing the boundaries of our brand and measuring your impact along the way.
  
  
Your role as a Creative Director is to be a craft leader that helps bring Atlassian products to life through well-crafted campaigns across all our channels and customer touch points. We are looking for a product-minded creative, experienced in campaign thinking and visual storytelling with a portfolio that shows an attention to design detail. We work in a collaborative environment: your intellectual curiosity and strategic thinking will be a plus. You will expected to show business impact and produce creative solutions that help our team achieve our goals with thoughtful customer-centric creative work.
  
  
**Responsibilities**
**In this role, you will:**

* Work with a CD/CW counterpart on conceptual challenges big and small. From full brand campaigns to tactical one off events.
* Be a craft expert who elevates the creative bar at Atlassian with fresh viewpoints, experiences, and interests.
* Be a brand champion to colleagues across the organization, and work with leadership to develop how creative impacts the business and our growth directly.
* Work on a tight-knit team, alongside with partners from marketing and brand design, involved in the end-to-end marketing process from ideation to implementation.
* Concept and deliver robust brand and product campaigns and experiences.
* Push and challenge assumptions through productive debate, which leads to innovation and better outcomes.
* Direct and collaborate with agency partners to execute on behalf of the Atlassian brand.

**Qualifications**
**Your background:**

* 10+ years of Art Direction experience in a mix of agency and in house creative departments demonstrated with an exciting portfolio that highlights award worthy thinking and work. Experience in technology a plus.
* Experience collaborating with a diverse team in a culture motivated by innovation, huge plus if you've worked with distant teammates and understand the communication patterns of working with distributed teams.
* A portfolio that showcases projects that demonstrate familiarity with complex brands and messaging.
* An understanding of the formal elements of design, including typography, layout, and color.
* Experience that spans film, web, print, motion, experiential, and campaign world.
* An appreciation of feedback as a gift.
* Exceptional visual, verbal and written skills.
* A shared belief that collaboration improves creativity.
* Experience working with cross-functional partners in marketing and strategy organizations, as well as direct oversight of external partners like agencies and freelancers.
* Confidence in presenting and articulating your work to peers, partners, and leadership.
* Expertise with the Adobe Creative Suite, and collaboration software for presentations. Experience in Figma a plus.

**More About Our Creative Team**
The Creative Studio is Atlassian's dynamic internal creative agency embedded within the marketing organization. Collectively, the team defines, articulates, and scales how millions of users experience and connect with the Atlassian brand from multiple dimensions. Focused on articulating the messaging of our brand and products to consumers, you will be amongst the designers, illustrators, writers, and animators who combine strategy with research, creativity, and craft to build and shape how we're viewed by the world.
  
  
**Compensation**
At Atlassian, we try to design equitable, explainable, and fair compensation programs. To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. Base pay within the range is determined by a candidate's skills and experience. In the United States, we have three geographic pay zones. For this role, our current base pay ranges for new hires in each zone are:
  
  
Zone A: $168,100 - $224,200
  
  
Zone B: $151,300 - $201,700
  
  
Zone C: $139,500 - $186,100
  
  
This role may also be eligible for benefits, bonuses, commissions, and equity.
  
  
Please visit go.atlassian.com/payzones for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones. However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter.
  
  
**Our Perks & Benefits**
Atlassian offers a variety of perks and benefits to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health coverage, paid volunteer days, wellness resources, and so much more. Visit
**go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits**
to learn more.
  
  
**About Atlassian**
At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.
  
  
We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
  
  
To provide you the best experience, we can support with accommodations or adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process. Simply inform our Recruitment team during your conversation with them.
  
  
To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit
**go.atlassian.com/crh**
**.**

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Altrata is a leading B2B SaaS company that delivers people intelligence to companies all over the world.

To ensure a successful launch and to effectively migrate and update existing customers to this innovative platform, we’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager to support our go-to-market (GTM) strategy, messaging refinement, and sales enablement support. This role will work closely with internal teams and external partners to ensure a seamless rollout, high adoption, and strong revenue impact.

**About the Role**

The Product Marketing Manager will help drive positioning, GTM strategy, and customer evolution efforts, ensuring the new platform resonates with both existing and new enterprise customers. This individual will work closely with an external agency delivering detailed personas and buyer journeys, engaging creative assets and a dedicated sales enablement team.

**Key Responsibilities**

1. Go-to-Market (GTM) & Product Launch Execution

* Assist in the execution of the GTM strategy for the new enterprise platform, ensuring alignment with the rest of marketing, sales, and client success teams.
* Ensure strong internal alignment across teams for a successful product introduction to the market.
* Leverage external persona and buyer journey research to refine value propositions and tailor messaging to different segments.
* Partner with the copywriter to develop compelling, differentiated messaging that resonates with enterprise buyers and executive search firms.
* Work with external agencies and internal teams to develop launch campaigns, thought leadership content, and high-impact marketing assets.

2. Customer Migration Strategy & Execution

* Support the customer migration plan to ensure a smooth transition from legacy products to the new platform.
* Leverage budget plus internal resources for interactive demos, videos, infographics, and data visualizations to simplify complex information and create excitement.
* Collaborate with client success teams to address concerns, overcome objections, and ensure retention throughout the migration process.
* Continuously gather and analyze customer feedback to iterate and optimize the migration experience.

3. Sales Enablement & Training Influence

* Work closely with the dedicated sales enablement team to ensure they have the right positioning, battle cards, and sales tools to train teams effectively.
* Provide ongoing competitive intelligence, buyer insights, and key messaging frameworks to help sales communicate value.
* Ensure sales enablement materials reflect the most current personas and buyer journeys developed by external partners.
* Influence the sales enablement team by bringing customer and market insights, training needs, and field feedback into enablement strategies.

4. Content & Creative Asset Utilization

* Maximize the impact of the creative resources by ensuring assets such as interactive demos, videos, and infographics align with key messaging and GTM initiatives.
* Collaborate with designers and content teams to create high-impact materials for the website, email campaigns, and social media.
* Ensure all creative assets are strategically deployed across multiple channels for maximum engagement and adoption impact.

5. Competitive & Market Intelligence

* Conduct ongoing competitive analysis to refine positioning and equip sales with clear differentiation strategies.
* Monitor market trends and customer insights to ensure the platform remains compelling and relevant to enterprise buyers.
* Use data-driven insights to optimize messaging, campaign effectiveness, and market penetration strategies.

**Qualifications & Experience**

* 3-5 years of product marketing experience, preferably in B2B SaaS, enterprise software, tech industries.
* Strong track record of leading GTM strategies for new product launches.
* Experience with customer migration and change management in a SaaS environment.
* Exceptional storytelling, positioning, and messaging skills, with the ability to turn complex data-driven solutions into clear, compelling narratives.
* Strong experience working with personas, customer journeys, and competitive research, and the ability to evolve insights over time.
* Demonstrated success in supporting sales enablement, training programs, and competitive positioning.
* Proven ability to collaborate with agencies, designers, and video producers to create impactful marketing materials.
* Familiarity with tools such as Salesforce, Pardot, or analytics platforms.

Preferred Certifications (Nice-to-Have)

* Pragmatic Institute (Pragmatic Marketing Certified - PMC)
* Product Marketing Alliance (PMA) Certifications

Altrata provides the most essential intelligence and insight on business leaders, the global wealthy and well-connected. Leading commercial, philanthropic, and educational institutions depend on Altrata solutions to meet their growth objectives. Clients partner with Altrata to confidently engage with exceptional individuals and organizations, create meaningful relationships and seize strategic opportunities.

We are a globally distributed team but we are looking for someone on the East Coast to make the most of the working hours overlap with London and India.
